value.name: Ex-Officer Is Sentenced to 6 Years in Beating of Unarmed Man
value.description: The former St. Paul, Minn., officer was convicted of using excessive force against a civilian who resembled the description of an armed suspect from a street fight.

value.name: Even before latest probe, feds deeply familiar with Minneapolis police
value.description: Federal authorities pursuing their civil rights probe of the Minneapolis Police Department bring with them a deep familiarity with the MPD's inner workings and procedures after years of concern about the department's performance.

value.name: A year after Floyd’s death, activists in Minneapolis seek end to ‘status quo’ racism
value.description: One year ago today, George Floyd's murder by former policeman Derek Chauvin in Minneapolis shocked the country, but those within the community, particularly Black residents, say it was inevitable. They point to a history of racist policies and political gridlock as reasons for the deaths of Black men like Floyd and Philando Castile.

value.description: George Floyd’s killing at the hands of police transformed lives around the world, but nowhere as profoundly as in the city where it occurred.

value.name: On anniversary, Minneapolis reflects on how George Floyd’s death changed their community forever
value.description: The year since the killing of George Floyd has been emotional for many Twin Cities residents. Here they talk about their fear, frustration and disillusionment. But they also found reasons to feel hopeful.

value.name: Panel: Faith community must lead slavery reparations
value.description: The faith community should guide the way on reparations for America's history of slavery and racial discrimination and help the nation's process of reconciliation and healing, religious leaders said during a panel held to discuss the issue.
